WRITING.TEXT: YES. I have always had OCD, but it was not until I started taking Vyvanse for ADD that my eating disorder developed. It is 100% the reason why I began obsessing over food, diet, exercise, etc. It is a major stimulant that, at least for me, raised my anxiety and obsession over things. I also used it as a weight loss pill and I seriously regret ever taking it. I would strongly recommend to get off of it as soon as possible. For me at least, the longer I was on Vyvanse the worse my ED symptoms became.
This post was really uplifting!!! Thanks for sharing!! :) Congrats on getting your life back. I hope all of us here can found the peace you have!

Trust me, it is all a distortion. There is no way 2.4 pounds (most of which is likely water/actual food weight, not fat) would give you the excess you describe as fat hanging on you.
I went through a phase where I would eat something (even a "safe" food) and then go look in the mirror and i swore my face appeared 5 times larger than before and I was wrong. I would go back 2 hours later and think to myself how embarrassed I was for losing weight so quickly and how everyone must know something is wrong.. Point is It's all in our heads and is not reality.
You're experiencing body dysmorphia, which is terrible and I feel for you. But please know NO ONE else is going to notice a 2.4 increase on the scale on you.
